examples: The photoelectric effect describes what happens when you shine a beam of light on a metal plate.
Einstein realized this could explain the photoelectric effect .
We also talked about photons, and how the photoelectric effect proves the particle nature of light.
But Einstein suggested a way to prove whether light traveled in these discrete packets: an experiment involving the photoelectric effect.

One thing that's astounding about Einstein's publications in 1905 is that they spanned such a large breadth of physics: after illuminating the quantum nature of light by explaining the photoelectric effect in March, in April he turned to something apparently more mundane: particles suspended in fluids.
words.defineEn: of or pertaining to photoelectricity
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến quang điện

examples: The Kepler photometer detects that dip in brightness and it records it.
The Kepler space telescope has an instrument called a photometer.
Kepler pointed a highly sensitive light sensor, called a photometer, at a single patch of sky, and it checked for changes in the stars’ brightness.
words.defineEn: photographic equipment that measures the intensity of light
words.defineVi: thiết bị chụp ảnh đo cường độ ánh sáng

examples: The team found the planets using a common method called transit photometry.
The plan was to do this by performing an astrometry and photometry survey.
words.defineEn: the scientific measurement of light in terms of its intensity, color, and other properties
words.defineVi: phép đo khoa học về ánh sáng về cường độ, màu sắc và các tính chất khác của nó

examples: But if you ever had glow-in-the-dark stars on your ceiling at night, you’ve seen phosphorescence at work.
Unlike fluorescence and phosphorescence, triboluminescence tends to be a brief flash of light.
Phosphorescence in nature is actually fairly rare, because it’s hard to get a rock with forbidden transitions at just the right energies needed to emit visible light in that way.
The reason for this is that phosphorescence works almost exactly like fluorescence, but with one key difference.
Another mechanism that makes rocks glow is called phosphorescence, and it was also named after a natural substance: phosphorus.
words.defineEn: a fluorescence that persists after the bombarding radiation has ceased
words.defineVi: một huỳnh quang vẫn tồn tại sau khi bức xạ bắn phá đã ngừng

examples: The new laws only further cemented the subordinate status of black people.
The new laws only further cemented the subordinate status of black people.
They can subordinate their views to his and get onboard, or they can quit.
Finally, Gabriella's parents are likely to be subordinate bilinguals who learn a secondary language by filtering it through their primary language.
They have a strict social hierarchy and usually there are two codominant males, subordinate males, and females in the colony.
words.defineEn: make subordinate, dependent, or subservient
words.defineVi: làm cho cấp dưới, phụ thuộc, hoặc phụ thuộc

examples: The public was skeptical of the politician's claims of innocence, and the subsequent investigation proved that there is no smoke without fire.
The subsequent depression lasted until 1843.
And subsequent studies have provided evidence that this is really happening.
And thus, his subsequent fate is a demonstration of this.
So look for that tomorrow and then a few subsequent Saturdays.
words.defineEn: coming or existing after something else; following
words.defineVi: đến hoặc tồn tại sau một cái gì đó khác; tiếp theo

words.defineEn: abject or cringing submissiveness
words.defineVi: sự khuất phục hoặc co rúm lại

examples: The Handmaid's Tale imagines a future in which the conservative counter-movement gains the upper hand and not only demolishes the progress women had made toward equality, but makes women completely subservient to men.
They've been stereotyped as a seductress, as subservient, as diseased.
Zeus deemed humans subservient creatures vulnerable to the elements and dependent on the gods for protection.

So in the colonial era, most American women of European descent lived lives much like those of their European counterparts: They were legally and socially subservient to men and trapped within a patriarchal structure.
And why do we have to be so subservient to global bureaucracies and unelected bureaucrats who want to control our energy sector?
words.defineEn: compliant and obedient to authority
words.defineVi: phục tùng và tuân theo thẩm quyền

examples: The struggles of black farmers have been particularly acute.
The last one was an acute angle.
The acute medical therapy is indicated in the exposure.
So this is an acute angle right over here.
When we cut it into slices, each of the eight triangles is acute.
words.defineEn: severe in degree; very serious
words.defineVi: nghiêm trọng về mức độ; rất nghiêm trọng

words.defineEn: shrewdness shown by keen insight
words.defineVi: sự khôn ngoan được thể hiện bằng cái nhìn sâu sắc

examples: And there's a thing called the Problem Solvers Caucus, which is bicameral.
We have got these bipartisan and bicameral, meaning House and Senate, groups that are trying to come up with a deal.
words.defineEn: composed of two legislative bodies
words.defineVi: gồm hai cơ quan lập pháp

examples: Amid the protests, part of the Whitney's biennial exhibit was a project called Triplechaser, which is named after a tear gas canister that breaks into three parts.

ICEX is a three week biennial exercise that offers the US navy the opportunity to assess its operational readiness in the Arctic, and train with other services, partner nations, and allies to increase capability in the region and maintain regional stability while improving capabilities to operate in the Arctic.
While cost overruns at the Olympics are something of a biennial tradition, a number of factors made Japan's expenditures worse.
words.defineEn: having a life cycle lasting two seasons
words.defineVi: có vòng đời kéo dài hai mùa

examples: It's increasingly also bifurcating and ultimately that's not going to be good for the global economy.
And how much thinking goes on inside of Amazon about a bifurcated workforce?
They cling there, with tiny bifurcated toes.
words.defineEn: divide into two branches
words.defineVi: chia thành hai nhánh

examples: Interviewer: If convicted on all counts of bigamy, Tom could spend up to twenty years in prison.
I have a long standing opposition to bigamy.
words.defineEn: the state of having two spouses at the same time
words.defineVi: tình trạng có hai vợ chồng cùng một lúc

examples: It negotiated bilateral deals directly with pharmaceutical firms.
Bilateral control does the kind of illogical thing of saying.
They have bilateral symmetry and a notochord during development and a skeleton as an adult, among other characteristics of this group of animals.
They have bilateral symmetry and a notochord during development and a skeleton as an adult, among other characteristics of this group of animals.
two dimensional Bilateral animals suddenly had a new dimension to play with.
words.defineEn: having two sides or parts
words.defineVi: có hai mặt hoặc các bộ phận

examples: He wants to become bilingual and speak multiple languages fluently.
My channel is turning bilingual.
Bilingual people get Strooped in both languages they speak.
And Junior is my bilingual student.
In fact, a lot of babies from bilingual families grow up fluent in both languages.
words.defineEn: describing the ability to speak, understand, or use two languages fluently
words.defineVi: mô tả khả năng nói, hiểu hoặc sử dụng hai ngôn ngữ trôi chảy

examples: Of course, it’s not always a single shrimp-fish pair: both the shrimps and the gobies will live with their mates, too, bringing the twosome to a foursome, or even a fivesome, since the shrimps frequently form thruples instead of couples.
words.defineEn: four people considered as a unit
words.defineVi: bốn người được coi là một đơn vị

examples: Many people enjoy celebrating Independence Day on the Fourth of July.
Top executives at pandemic juggernauts Pfizer and Moderna are at odds on the need for a fourth COVID-19 vaccine dose.
Jim beat me for the fourth time, so I threw in the towel.
"Fourths," answered the next student.
Fourth, opportunities that I've had.
words.defineEn: coming or happening just after the third person or thing
words.defineVi: đến hoặc xảy ra ngay sau người thứ ba hoặc điều

examples: Unlike the other Celtic tribes, Roman legions have no regard for the druids’ sacred role as peacemakers.
On the lid we've got our nice eliminated Legion logo.
Servius’s legion and three others with him today are under the command of Emperor Tiberius’s nephew Germanicus, named for his father’s military successes against the Germanic tribes.
Last year, some legions in the area revolted, demanding better pay and a cut in the length of service.
And she's got a legion of TV fans too, who have made her show on The Food Network a longtime hit.
words.defineEn: archaic terms for army
words.defineVi: thuật ngữ cổ cho quân đội

examples: And the life of a legionary is dangerous and grueling.
Servius enlisted as a legionary eight years ago at age 18, the son of a poor farmer with few prospects.
Unlike the majority of legionaries, he doesn’t gamble, so he’s been able to save most of his wages.
words.defineEn: a soldier who is a member of a legion (especially the French Foreign Legion)
words.defineVi: một người lính là thành viên của một quân đoàn (đặc biệt là Quân đoàn nước ngoài của Pháp)
